On 1/19/06, Robert Lucente <rlucente@...> wrote:
>
> Googled and f=
ound http://www.w3.org/DOM/Test/Documents/DOMTSBuild.html.
>
> The above st=
ates, "If you get a out of memory error (very likely if you
> build the DOM=
 Level 3 Core tests)". It then recommends "set
> ANT_OPTS=3D-Xmx512M". Requ=
est that people share how they solved their "out
> of
> memory" issue.


FY=
I, we did this in TestNG by allowing @Factories to return either test
class=
es or iterators.  In the latter case, the iterators are walked one
element =
at a time, the yielded elements are considered as test classes (or
further =
iterators) and run, and then we move on to the next element.

Some of our u=
sers are creating thousands of tests and they were running out
of memory wi=
thout this feature.  It's marginal, but when you need it, you
really need i=
t.

Hope JUnit4 will provide it.

--
C=E9dric
